field.name: help

ul.li: ‚úì Paper Bale Created - Go to: Operations > Paper Recycling > Paper Bales
‚úì Inspection Standards - Configure grade purity thresholds (WHT: 95%+, MIX: 80%+, OCC: 90%+)
‚úì Quality Control Training - Staff must be trained on contamination identification

ol.li: Open Paper Bale record (status: Weighed or In Stock)
System auto-creates inspection record with bale details
Inspector visually examines bale: cut bands to expose layers
Check for contamination: plastics, metals, food waste, non-paper items
Estimate purity percentage: % of bale that is correct grade
WHT (white office): Must be 95%+ white office paper, no colored/glossy
OCC (cardboard): 90%+ corrugated cardboard, no wax-coated boxes
Record Pass/Fail status based on purity threshold
If FAIL: Document contamination type (plastic straps, staples, food residue)
Take photos of contamination for customer evidence
If FAIL: Bale returns to Cancelled status, re-shredded or downgraded
If PASS: Bale confirmed as In Stock, ready for shipment
Add Inspector Notes: unusual findings, customer-specific issues
Inspection log attached to bale record for audit trail

ul.li: Plastic Items: Binders, sheet protectors, laminated documents, plastic straps
Metal Fasteners: Staples, paper clips, binder clips, spiral bindings
Food Waste: Coffee grounds, food wrappers, grease stains
Non-Paper Materials: Fabric, rubber bands, foam packaging
Wrong Grade Paper: Glossy magazines in white grade, newspaper in OCC
Hazardous Materials: Carbon paper, thermal fax paper (BPA contamination)

field.p:
üöÄ Key Features:
‚Ä¢ Pass/Fail Determination: Auto-compare purity % to grade standards
‚Ä¢ Photo Documentation: Attach contamination images to inspection record
‚Ä¢ Contamination Tagging: Categorize by type for trend analysis
‚Ä¢ Grade Downgrade Logic: Auto-suggest lower grade if purity borderline
‚Ä¢ Customer Notification: Alert customer if their bales frequently fail
‚Ä¢ Rejection Tracking: Count fail rate by customer for education/penalties
‚Ä¢ Audit Trail: Complete inspection history for mill quality disputes

üí° Pro Tips:
‚Ä¢ Inspect random layers throughout bale - contamination often hidden in center
‚Ä¢ Photograph fails immediately - customer disputes resolved with visual evidence
‚Ä¢ Document specific customer patterns (e.g., always includes binders) for education
‚Ä¢ Re-inspect after re-shredding to ensure contamination removed
‚Ä¢ Failed bales can often be downgraded (WHT ‚Üí MIX) instead of full rejection
